content.text:
# List of municipalities in Delaware

Delaware is a state located in the Southern United States. According to the 2016 United States Census estimate, Delaware is the 6th least populous state with  inhabitants and the 2nd smallest by land area spanning  of land. Delaware is divided into three counties and contains 57 incorporated places consisting of cities, towns, and villages. Of these, there are 10 cities, 3 villages, and 44 towns.
As of 2020, the largest municipality by population in Delaware is Wilmington with 70,898 residents, while the largest by area is Dover which spans .  The smallest municipality by both measurements is Hartly with 73 residents in an area of .
List of municipalities
File:Wilmington Delaware skyline.jpg|alt=Skyline of Wilmington|Skyline of Wilmington, the largest city in Delaware
File:Dover Delaware.jpg|alt=Downtown Dover|Downtown Dover, capital and second largest municipality of Delaware

File:Main Street NB approaching Commerce Street Smyrna DE.jpeg|alt=Downtown Smyrna|Downtown Smyrna, Delaware's fifth largest municipality
File:Walnut Street NB at Park Avenue Milford DE.jpeg|alt=Downtown Milford|Downtown Milford, sixth largest municipality in Delaware
File:High Street, Seaford, Delaware (2006).jpg|alt=Downtown Seaford|Downtown Seaford, Delaware's seventh largest municipality
